
### ownership exercise  {.smaller}

If called like <code>p = foo(p)</code>, which follow single-owner rule? <br> 
:::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="50%"}
 
```
// (A)
char *foo(char *p) {
    free(p);
    return NULL;
}

// (B)
char *foo(char *p) {
    p = realloc(p, strlen(p) + 100);
    strcat(p, "test");
    return p;
}

```
 
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
 
```
// (C)
char *global;
char *foo(char *p) {
    if (p) free(p);
    return global;
}

// (D)
char *foo(char *p) {
    p[0] = 'A';
    return p;
}

```
